About Me

BIO

Hey! My name is Daniel Roh and I am a software developer from Orange County, CA who loves to build applications that make differences in peoples' everyday lives. When I am not coding, I like to play sports and eat Korean BBQ and tacos whenever I can. Let's get in touch and make a difference.

StadiumDash

Software Engineer

StadiumDash is a food delivery mobile app that caters to fans at live sporting events. I built key features for this app which cross-platform for both IOS and Android devices. Also, I assisted in creating the UI design which was built with React Native and a realtime database and backend with Google Firebase.

Redwood Code Academy

Full Stack Developer

Redwood Code Academy is a full-time, 12 week intensive bootcamp where I developed fullstack web and mobile apps. I built the applications with HTML, CSS, ReactJS, React Native, C#, NodeJS, SQL, and MongoDB. I collaborated with senior and mid-level developers to build apps with a strong emphasis on clean code

UCLA Department of Medicine/Statistics

Fund Manager

In my past life, I worked as a fund manager at the UCLA Department of Medicine and Statistics. I managed the financial accounts for faculty members who were awarded grants and contracts for their research.
